turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Shoreham Tollbridge.
turn.1: What is the significance of Shoreham Tollbridge?
turn.2: At the time the bridge closed it was the last public road bridge in Sussex to be controlled by a toll.
turn.3: Is the bridge still used today?
turn.4: The bridge transferred to the ownership of West Sussex County Council where it remains.
turn.6: The bridge has since been classified as a Grade II* listed building and is preserved as a building of historic interest.
turn.8: During 2008 the bridge underwent a major refurbishment with the aim of extending its life for a further 30 years.
turn.10: The bridge has now been designated a bridleway and is a popular local landmark used by both leisure and commuter traffic on foot, bicycle and horseback.
turn.11: Is the area around the bridge kept clean?
turn.12: It is also a popular spot for local fisherman.
